data.meta_description: Last weekend, I had the pleasure of attending the 30th anniversary celebration for BIG. For the first time, it was held at my home track at Oxford City ACâ€¦
data.text:
Hello March... Hello Fellas Happy New Month to y'all. Can you believe it's March already? How has it been all along the way. This is the month that ends the first quarter. Time really flies, doesn't it? Anyway, I just wanted to drop by and wish you all a Happy New Month! So, how's everyone doing? Can you believe we're already wrapping up the first quarter of the year? How are those goals shaping up? Making some headway, or hitting a few bumps in the road No matter where you're at, take a moment to give yourself a pat on the back. Every little step forward counts! And as we kick off March, let's set our sights on what we want to achieve. Whether it's chasing after big dreams or celebrating small victories, let's go for it! Here's to Marchâ€”a month full of opportunities, growth, and maybe even a surprise or two. Let's make it one for the books! Happy New Month, everyone! Let's make it amazing! #happynewmonth #march #challenge #goalsettingtips #linkedingrowth

Sapience from the Grad 1 The second activity Max participated in yesterday was the fill-in the bottle competition which was between him and another graduand (a female). Both of them appeared ready for the task but one obviously had a better understanding of the goal. The two bottles were kept few meters apart while two buckets filled with water were kept at the opposite far end. A little cup was put in the buckets to enable the contenders fetch some water, then run with it to the other end and pour into their bottles. This was to be repeated until the bottle is filled. At the blow of a whistle, the competition began. The both contenders understood the first instruction -using the cup to fetch from the bucket, run to the other end and pour into the bottle. However, it was glaring that Max didn't understand that whoever fills the bottle first becomes the winner, hence, he poured most of his water away. On the other hand, the girl understood not just the task but the aim and techniques. While Max's bottle was half full, the girl's bottle was full ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ The final whistle made my son realize that a winner had emerged. That not withstanding, I cheered him on (though he already understood that he lost) Sapience: every competition (personal/interpersonal) has rules, timeframe and goals. Understanding these before embarking on competitions will guarantee success.

Summer is almost here and there's no better time to head out for an Ohio adventure. Whether you're making memories with the family over a picnic, or exploring a hidden gem within the state, Ohio offers plenty of ways to keep you playing all season long. Check out this list of the top 100 things to do in Ohio this summer and discover your heart of adventure. You can also download a checklist of the "100 Things To Do in Ohio this Summer." https://lnkd.in/gD5xRefF
